turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Guttula sibogae.
turn.1: What do you know about Guttula sibogae?
turn.2: Guttula sibogae Guttula sibogae is a species of extremely small deep water sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Seguenziidae.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: (Original description by Schepman) The height of the shell attains 5.5 mm.
turn.5: What about the shape of the shell?
turn.6: The shell has a conoidal shape with elevated spire.
turn.7: What else can you tell me about the shell?
turn.8: The periphery and the base are rounded, perforate and pearly.
turn.9: Is there anything else unique about the shell?
turn.10: The outer layer, if present, is very thin and pellucid. The five whorls are very convex and smooth.
turn.11: Is there anything else I should know about the shell?
turn.12: Only under a strong lens very faint growth striae and microscopic punctuations may be observed.
